##Requirements

```{r}
install.packages("magick")
```

##Usage

```{r}
library(imageFilter)
library(magick)

# Read an image

img <- image_read("path/to/your/image.jpg")

# Convert to bitmap

bitmap <- img[[1]]

# Apply grayscale filter

gray_img <- apply_filter(bitmap, greyscale_filter)
print(gray_img)

# Apply cutoff filter (black or magenta)

cutoff_img <- apply_filter(bitmap, cutoff_filter, cutoff = 128)
print(cutoff_img)
```

##How it works

-   apply_filter() function iterates through each pixel of an imageâ€™s bitmap and applies a user-defined filter function. Two example filters are included:

    -   greyscale_filter() â€“ converts RGB pixels to grayscale.

    -   cutoff_filter() â€“ assigns black or magenta based on brightness.
